definition: abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Akela belongs to a bad element in this city.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉屬於這個城市的壞分子。

sentences.english: Arcola is a Title One school, which means it serves a large population of students from low-income families.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉小學是一所面向社會低收入者子女的公益學校。

sentences.english: He recently met with West African health officials in the Ghanaian capital, Accra.
sentences.chinese: 最近他與西非健康官員在加納首都阿克拉會面。

sentences.english: The flight to Accra goes twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 飛往阿克拉的班機一星期開兩班。

sentences.english: But Obama also said in Accra that the future of Africa is up to Africans.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統在阿克拉表示，非洲的未來取決於非洲人。

sentences.english: The appearances in Moscow and Accra will be bookends around another round of important multilateral summitry .
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科和阿克拉之行將要列入一系列多國峯會之列。

sentences.english: Akela asked a 16 years old young girl to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉向一個16歲的女孩求婚。

sentences.english: He went to Accra, the capital, to meet with bankers and businesspeople.
sentences.chinese: 他去了首都阿克拉去會見銀行家和商人。

sentences.english: The Ghanaians took part from a distance learning center in Accra.
sentences.chinese: 加納人蔘加了位於阿克拉的遠程中心。

sentences.english: Akela's words don't relate with the facts.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉的話與事實不符。

sentences.english: Akela is a devil in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉在我心裏是個惡魔。

sentences.english: A city of south-central Ghana northwest of Accra.
sentences.chinese: 庫馬西加納中南部一城市，位於阿克拉西北。

sentences.english: Water flow into homes is a big challenge, even in Accra.
sentences.chinese: 讓水流入家庭是個嚴峻的挑戰，即使是在阿克拉。

definition: Dhaka, capital of Bangladesh/(Tw) Dakar, capital of Senegal
Bangui, capital of Central African Republic
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Safi (Moroccan city on the Atlantic coast)
